stages.title: Define Your Computer Science Vision
stages.description: Clarify your interests in software engineering, AI, systems, or theory, and identify target universities.

Global.overview: Top CS programs value strong math foundations, programming skills, and clear specialization interests. Start by identifying your focus area.
checklist: Research 5-7 top CS programs (MIT, Stanford, Carnegie Mellon, Cambridge, ETH Zurich)
Identify your specialization (AI/ML, systems, theory, software engineering, cybersecurity)
Assess your programming experience and math preparation
Create a 3-year roadmap connecting coding, projects, and applications

US.overview: US programs emphasize AP/IB rigor, programming projects, and research. Combine strong academics with coding experience.
checklist: Complete AP Computer Science A and AP Calculus BC
Build a portfolio of programming projects
Research reach, target, and safety schools for CS
Identify summer programs (MIT, Stanford, research internships)

UK.overview: UK programs prioritize A-levels, STEP/MAT, and strong personal statements. Focus on mathematics and computing.
checklist: Review entry requirements for Cambridge, Oxford, Imperial CS programs
Outline UCAS personal statement connecting math/computing to CS

Asia.overview: Bridge national curricula with global standards. Emphasize programming and problem-solving.
checklist: Review programming and algorithms in national exams
Explore summer programs at top Asian universities
Document interest in specific CS specializations

quiz.q: Which test is important for UK CS admissions?
What do top US CS programs value most?

stages.title: Build Programming Skills & Projects
stages.description: Develop coding skills through projects, competitions, and technical coursework.

Global.overview: Demonstrate CS ability through tangible programming projects. Build, code, and document your work.
checklist: Learn multiple programming languages (Python, Java, C++)
Participate in coding competitions or hackathons
Create a GitHub portfolio showcasing your code
projectIdeas: Build a web application or mobile app
Develop a game or interactive program

US.overview: Link projects to competitions, research, and summer programs.
checklist: Submit project to hackathon or coding competition
Apply to CS summer programs or research internships

UK.overview: Integrate projects into EPQ or personal investigations.
checklist: Draft EPQ proposal on CS topic
Link project to university course modules
Include project in UCAS personal statement
Prepare to discuss code in interviews

Asia.overview: Use competitions to build standout portfolios.
checklist: Participate in IOI, ICPC, or local coding competitions
Work with university mentor on project

quiz.q: What's the best way to demonstrate CS skills?
opts: Build programming projects and showcase them on GitHub
quiz.correct: Build programming projects and showcase them on GitHub

stages.title: Strengthen Academic Foundation
stages.description: Excel in mathematics, algorithms, and computer science theory.

Global.overview: Strong math and algorithmic thinking is essential for CS.

US.overview: Prioritize AP courses and competitive programming.
checklist: Complete AP Computer Science A and AP Calculus BC
Participate in USACO or similar competitions

UK.overview: Excel in A-levels and prepare for STEP/MAT.
checklist: Solve past STEP or MAT papers
Study computing or computer science A-level

Asia.overview: Integrate with national exams while building international readiness.
checklist: Bridge local curriculum to international standards

quiz.q: What academic areas are most critical for computer science?

stages.title: Craft Your CS Narrative
stages.description: Translate your programming skills and projects into compelling applications.

Global.overview: Connect your CS passion, projects, and achievements into a cohesive story.
checklist: Highlight specific programming projects and impact
Connect coding to solving real-world problems
Get feedback from mentors or teachers

US.overview: Focus on Common App essays and activity descriptions.
checklist: Draft Common App essay with CS focus
Optimize Activities section to highlight projects

UK.overview: Perfect UCAS statement and prepare for interviews.

Asia.overview: Adapt narrative for multiple university systems.
checklist: Prepare statements for UCAS and Common App
Draft reflection on CS career goals

quiz.q: What should your CS personal statement highlight?
opts: Programming passion, technical projects, and problem-solving
quiz.correct: Programming passion, technical projects, and problem-solving

stages.title: Final Preparation & Interviews
stages.description: Polish applications and prepare for technical interviews.

Global.overview: Bring together all your work for confident applications.
checklist: Prepare to discuss projects and algorithms

US.overview: Rehearse for interviews and finalize applications.

UK.overview: Prepare for Oxbridge interviews with problem-solving.

checklist: Prepare to discuss code and algorithms

opts: Clear explanation of algorithms and problem-solving approach
quiz.correct: Clear explanation of algorithms and problem-solving approach
